titleStmt.title: Polymer crystallization after short time pressure

analytic.title: Polymer crystallization after short time pressure

application.desc: GROBID - A machine learning software for extracting information from scholarly documents
application.label: unknown

div.p: In these studies, the amount of shear (200 mms/s, 8 mm displacement) was kept constant while the timing (before or after shear) and the amount of applied pressure varied. In these experiments, we focused on the formation of oriented structures upon cessation of shear, with and without the application of pressure.

The first material used was an ethylene copolymer of low "crystallizability" doped with 0.3 wt% of UHMW-PE. Experiments as described above showed that a pressure pulse of 200 bar before shearing can induce the formation of shish (Fig. 2b), whereas shear alone does not have this effect (Fig. 2a). Further SAXS and WAXD data analysis is ongoing.

figure.figDesc: Names and affiliations of applicants ( * indicates expermentalists):L.Balzano 1* , Z. Ma 1* , A. Ailianou 2 * 1 Technische Universiteit Eindhoven, Eindhoven, the Netherlands 2 California Institute of Technology, Pasadena, CA, USA Report: A series of crystallization experiments under flow and with/without application of pressure before shearing was performed at beamline B26 DUBBLE of the European Synchrotron Research Facility (ESRF) in Grenoble, France. All experiments were carried out in the Multipass Rheometer (MPR) shown in Fig. 1.

figure.head: Figure 1 :
figure.figDesc: Figure 1: a) Pressure cell installed at DUBBLE/BM26; b) Pressurization; c) Shear

figure.head: Figure 2 :
figure.figDesc: Figure 2: SAXS patterns a) after a shear pulse of 200 mm/s, 8mm; b) after application of 200 bar for 60s, release of pressure and subsequent application of 200 mm/s, 8mm
